intro: Cenostigma pinnatum, commonly known as the hairy antelope's foot, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its distinctive, pinnately compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
